benchmark_details.name: LifeTox
benchmark_details.overview: LifeTox is a dataset designed for identifying implicit toxicity within a broad range of advice-seeking scenarios, comprising diverse contexts derived from personal experiences through open-ended questions.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To contribute to the safer integration of large language models in everyday human interactions by understanding and detecting implicit toxicity.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The operational style of the LifeProTips forum may introduce bias in the standards of advice and the participantsâ€™ opinions may not represent all demographic groups.

data.source: Posts and comments crawled from the 'LifeProTips' and 'UnethicalLifeProTips' subreddits.
data.annotation: Human evaluation confirmed the labeling of comments as safe or unsafe based on community guidelines.

methods: Fine-tuning of RoBERTa on LifeTox dataset
methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated based on the classification performance of models trained on the LifeTox dataset.
methodology.interpretation: Higher Macro-F1 scores indicate better generalization ability in implicit toxicity detection.
methodology.baseline_results: RoBERTa fine-tuned on LifeTox outperformed existing models on multiple out-of-domain benchmarks.
methodology.validation: The effectiveness of LifeTox was validated through experiments comparing it against existing safety benchmarks.

harm: Harmful advice leading to social risks
